Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

This consent shall be restricted to a period of five years from the date of the consent.Reason:  This condition is specified by the Town and Country  Planning  (Control  of Advertisements) (England) Regulations 2007.

The intensity of the illumination of the panel signs  permitted by this consent shall be no greater than 600 cd/m2, and the intensity of illumination of all signage hereby approved shall not exceed the maximum luminence level set out within the Institution of Lighting Engineers in the  Professional Lighting Guide 05: The brightness of illuminated advertisements (2015).Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The signage permitted by this consent shall only be illuminated during the opening hours of the car park to which it relates.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
B1 - Means of Warning and Escape

The assessment of this application is based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify the validity of this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above, are agreed and that the Planning Condition 3 (Facing Materials) of planning permission 19/01811/FUL is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.

As part of the Council's Local List of Validation requirements this application needs to be accompanied by a supporting 'Basement Impact and Lighting Assessment'.  Please provide a copy of this assessment or an assessment explaining why you believe that such an assessment is not required.  A copy of the Royal Borough of Kingston's information requirements and guidance on what the assessment should contain are available on our website at www.kingston.gov.uk/planning.
Please provide a payment of £250 to accompany your application. This payment can be made online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Care Line on 020 8547 5022
